name: Kadison–Singer problem
rephrased: The Kadison–Singer problem asks whether pure states on certain C*-algebras have unique extensions to larger algebras.
implication_form: If a linear functional is a pure state on a certain C*-algebra, then its extension to a larger algebra is unique.
solved_by: Adam Marcus, Daniel Spielman, Nikhil Srivastava
explained: The Kadison-Singer problem, now a theorem proved in 2013, asks: If a pure state on the C*-algebra of bounded operators on a separable infinite-dimensional Hilbert space vanishes on the algebra of all diagonal operators (with respect to some orthonormal basis), must it be uniquely extendable to a pure state on the entire algebra of bounded operators? In simpler terms, it questions the uniqueness of extensions of certain states defined on a subalgebra to the whole algebra.
